briefdescription.para: Model of the concept Range with random access iterators, providing input points and normals through the following two property maps.
property map to access the location of an input point.
property map to access the unoriented normal of an input point
shape type.
shape type.
An Iterator_range with a bidirectional constant iterator type with value type boost::shared_ptr<Shape>.
An Iterator_range with a bidirectional constant iterator type with value type boost::shared_ptr<Plane_shape>.
An Iterator_range with a bidirectional iterator with value type std::size_t as indices into the input data that has not been assigned to a shape.

detaileddescription.para: As this range class has no size() method, the method Efficient_RANSAC::number_of_unassigned_points() is provided.

briefdescription.para: Constructs an empty shape detection object.
Releases all memory allocated by this instances including shapes.
Retrieves the traits class.
Retrieves the point property map.
Retrieves the normal property map.
range of input data.
property map to access the position of an input point.
property map to access the normal of an input point.
Sets the input data.

detaileddescription.para: The range must stay valid until the detection has been performed and the access to the results is no longer required. This function first calls clear().

briefdescription.para: Registers in the detection engine the shape type ShapeType that must inherit from Shape_base.

detaileddescription.para: For example, for registering a plane as detectable shape you should call region_growing.add_shape_factory< Shape_detection_3::Plane<Traits> >();.
Note that if your call is within a template, you should add the template keyword just before add_shape_factory: region_growing.template add_shape_factory< Shape_detection_3::Plane<Traits> >();.

simplesect.para: So far, region growing algorithm only supports plane detection.

briefdescription.para: Constructs internal data structures required for the shape detection.

detaileddescription.para: These structures only depend on the input data, i.e. the points and normal vectors. This method is called by detect(), if it was not called before by the user.

briefdescription.para: Removes all shape types registered for detection.
Removes all detected shapes.

detaileddescription.para: All internal structures are cleaned, including formerly detected shapes. Thus iterators and ranges retrieved through shapes(), planes() and indices_of_unassigned_points() are invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Performs the shape detection.

parameterdescription.para: can be omitted if the algorithm should be run without any callback. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped. Note that this interruption may leave the class in an invalid state.

simplesect.para: true if shape types have been registered and input data has been set. Otherwise, false is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns an Iterator_range with a bidirectional iterator with value type boost::shared_ptr<Shape> over the detected shapes in the order of detection.

simplesect.para: So far, region growing algorithm only supports plane detection, so this method is equivalent to planes() except that it returns planes with the abstract type Shape.

briefdescription.para: Returns an Iterator_range with a bidirectional iterator with value type boost::shared_ptr<Plane_shape> over only the detected planes in the order of detection.
Number of points not assigned to a shape.
Returns an Iterator_range with a bidirectional iterator with value type std::size_t as indices into the input data that has not been assigned to a shape.

memberdef.definition: typedef Search_traits_adapter<std::size_t, My_point_map, Search_traits_base> CGAL::Shape_detection_3::Region_growing< Traits >::Search_traits
memberdef.name: Search_traits

briefdescription.para: A shape detection algorithm using a region growing method.

detaileddescription.para: Given a point set in 3D space with unoriented normals, sampled on surfaces, this class enables to detect subsets of connected points lying on the surface of primitive shapes. Each input point is assigned to either none or at most one detected primitive shape. The implementation follows [1].
